title: What is a VoIP call? - Quora

response.answer_text: VoIP is an acronym for Voice Over Internet Protocol, or in more common terms phone service over the Internet.If you have a reasonable quality Internet connection you can get phone service delivered through your Internet connection instead of from your local phone company. Some people use VOIP in addition to their traditional phone service since VOIP service providers usually offer lower rates than traditional phone companies, but sometimes doesn’t offer 911 service, phone directory listings, 411 service, or other common phone services. While many VoIP providers offer these services, consistent industry-wide means of offering these are still developing. There are many service providers in the market who provides VoIP based virtual phone numbers for 150+ countries. So you can buy the virtual number of the country that you are targeting for your business and start making and receiving calls without being present in that country. You can also use features like: Call recording Call forwarding Call transfer IVR Virtual assistant Welcome messages Voicemail etc. These features are not available in the traditional phone system and that’s the reason why VoIP based virtual phone system is getting popular with each passing day.
